      • copyViaBytes

        public void copyViaBytes(String inputFile,
                String outputFile)
                  throws IOException
        Copies file by reading byte by byte. Very slow
        Parameters:
        inputFile - input file name with complete path.
        outputFile - output file name with complete path. The file may not even exist
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copyByCharacters

        public void copyByCharacters(String inputFile,
                    String outputFile)
                      throws IOException
        Copy files character by character. Very slow
        Parameters:
        inputFile - input file name with complete path.
        outputFile - output file name with complete path. The file may not even exist
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copyLines

        public void copyLines(String inputFile,
             String outputFile)
               throws IOException
        Copy file line by line CopyLines outputs each line using println, which appends the line terminator for the current operating system. This might not be the same line terminator that was used in the input file.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - input file name with complete path.
        outputFile - output file name with complete path. The file may not even exist
        Throws:
        IOException

      • copyByCharactersViaBuffer

                             String outputFile)
                               throws IOException
        Copy files character by character via buffer streams
        Parameters:
        inputFile - input file name with complete path.
        outputFile - output file name with complete path. The file may not even exist
        Throws:
        IOException

        public void nioMove(String sourceFile,
           String targetFile)
             throws IOException
        Moves a file to the target file. Preferably use this method for all your file moves
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - Source file name that has to be moved.

      • getPathStringSeparator

        public String getPathStringSeparator()
        Get the path separator for the given operating system The path separator for POSIX file systems is the forward slash, /, and for Microsoft Windows is the backslash, \. Other file systems might use other delimiters.
        Returns:
        the path separator as String
